revisions.rev:
'''Dulwich Grove MLR station''' is a planned light rail stop on the [[Metro Light Rail]] line in [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]] serving the suburb of [[Dulwich Hill, New South Wales|Dulwich Hill]]. The stop is located in a [[Cut (earthmoving)|cutting]] between New Canterbury Road and Hercules Street with access to the stop available from both streets. It is planned for completion in 2012. The extension will make use of the former Rozelle branch of the [[Metropolitan Goods railway line]] heavy rail freight corridor and operate from the current light rail terminus at [[Lilyfield MLR station|Lilyfield]] to [[Dulwich Hill Interchange MLR station|Dulwich Hill]].http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/rail/lightrail-extension.htmlhttp://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/file/rail/SLRE-Community-Update-July-August-2010.pdf Dulwich Grove was the name of one of the areaâs two earliest land releases and first use of the name Dulwich.[http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/files/publications/SLRE-Preliminary-Environmental-Assessment.pdf Sydney Light Rail Extension - Stage 1 - Inner West Extension - Preliminary Environmental Assessment.] Appendix A. Transport NSW. The stop is estimated to be used by 445 boarding passengers per weekday by 2016 with 140 of those arriving by bus. This is the second highest patronage of any stop on the extension.[http://majorprojects.planning.nsw.gov.au/files/61649/08_Environmental%20Assessment%20-%20Volume%201%20-%20Part%20C1%20-%20Chapter%2010.pdf Environmental Assessment - Volume 1 - Part C1 - Chapter 10.] Table 10.1 p 201. Transport NSW. ==Transport links== [[Sydney Buses]] runs five routes via Dulwich Grove MLR station: *Route 418 - between [[Tempe, New South Wales|Tempe]] and [[Burwood, New South Wales|Burwood]] *Route 428/L28 - between [[Canterbury railway station, Sydney|Canterbury station]] and the City *Routes 444/445 - between [[Campsie railway station|Campsie station]] and [[Balmain East Wharf]] ==Neighbouring stops==
